labels.analysis: The MCP Server focuses on processing and enriching web content for LLM applications. It provides tools for fetching, searching, extracting, summarizing, and capturing visual representations of web content. The primary functionality involves web content interaction and transformation, making it particularly useful for applications needing structured data from websites.
labels.reasoning: The primary label **Web Search & Research** was chosen because the server's main tools revolve around exploring and extracting structured information from web content. Secondary labels **Browser Automation** and **Content Creation** were selected because the server can automate web interactions and generate summarized or structured content from raw web data. No custom label is needed as existing categories sufficiently describe its functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Cloudflare Browser Rendering
server_info_crawled.author: @amotivv/cloudflare-browser-rendering-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Fetch and process web content seamlessly for your LLMs. Enhance your applications with structured content extraction, documentation search, and content summarization capabilities. Capture screenshots of web pages to enrich your context and insights.

tools.name: fetch_page
tools.description: Deploy Server Cloudflare Browser Rendering @amotivv/cloudflare-browser-rendering-mcp Try in Playground

tools.name: search_documentation
tools.description: Searches Cloudflare documentation and returns relevant content

tools.name: extract_structured_content
tools.description: Extracts structured content from a web page using CSS selectors

tools.name: summarize_content
tools.description: Summarizes web content for more concise LLM context

tools.name: take_screenshot
tools.description: Takes a screenshot of a web page and returns it as an image

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@amotivv/cloudflare-browser-rendering-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
